M. H.--313 
     Those who eat flesh are but eating grains and vegetables at second hand; for the animal receives 


                                                                   87 

from these things the nutrition that produces growth. The life that was in the grains and vegetables passes into the eater. We receive it by eating the flesh of the animal. How much better to get it direct, by eating the food that God provided for our use!  {TSDF 86.10}  
                                                            M.H.--316 
     It is a mistake to suppose that muscular strength depends on the use of animal food. The needs of the system can be better supplied, and more vigorous health can be enjoyed, without its use. The grains, with fruits, nuts, and vegetables, contain all the nutritive properties necessary to make good blood.
